newsitem.title: USA: Penril holders to meet Nov 15 on merger.
newsitem.headline: Penril holders to meet Nov 15 on merger.

text.p: Penril DataComm Network said Wednesday it scheduled a shareholders meeting for November 15 to vote on the spinoff of its networking products business and subsequent merger with Bay Networks Inc.

Bay plans to buy Penril's digital signal processing (DSP) modem business for $10 per share in stock. The networking products business would become a new publicly traded company called Access Beyond Inc.
Penril said Ronald Howard, 40, was expected to be chairman, chief executive officer and president of Access Beyond. He was president of Penril's datability networks unit.

Other expected members of Access's board of directors were Arthur Samberg, 55, president of investment advisor Dawson-Samberg Capital Management Inc, Barbara Perrier, 44, vice president and chief financial officer of Communication Systems Technology Inc, John Howard, 43, chief executive officer of Gryphon Capital Partners Corp, and Paul Schaller, 48, president of managment consulting firm Schaller Associates.
